hints_html:
Recall that polar form for a complex number z is

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle z=R\,\exp(i\theta)\end{aligned}\]

where R is the modulus of z and \(\theta\) is the argument.
hints_raw:
Recall that polar form for a complex number ''z'' is

:<math>
\displaystyle z=R\,\exp(i\theta)
</math>

where ''R'' is the modulus of ''z'' and <math>\theta</math> is the argument.
question: A 25
sols_html:
Our complex number is z=1+i. Therefore,

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle{}|z|=\sqrt{1+1}=\sqrt{2}\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \text{Arg}(z)=\arctan\left(\frac{1}{1}\right)=\arctan(1)=\frac{\pi}{4}\end{aligned}\]

since the vector 1+i is in the first quadrant. Therefore,

\[\begin{aligned} 1+i=\sqrt{2}\exp\left(\frac{\pi}{4}i\right)\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} (1+i)^{10}=2^{10/2}\exp\left(\frac{10\pi}{4}i\right)=32\exp\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}i\right).\end{aligned}\]

Now

\[\begin{aligned} \exp\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}i\right)=\cos\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}\right)+i\sin\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}\right)=i\end{aligned}\]

and therefore

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle{}(1+i)^{10}=32i.\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Our complex number is z=1+i.  Therefore,

:<math>
\displaystyle{}|z|=\sqrt{1+1}=\sqrt{2}
</math>

and 

:<math>
\text{Arg}(z)=\arctan\left(\frac{1}{1}\right)=\arctan(1)=\frac{\pi}{4}
</math>

since the vector 1+i is in the first quadrant.  Therefore,

:<math>
1+i=\sqrt{2}\exp\left(\frac{\pi}{4}i\right)
</math>

and

:<math>
(1+i)^{10}=2^{10/2}\exp\left(\frac{10\pi}{4}i\right)=32\exp\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}i\right).
</math>

Now

:<math>
\exp\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}i\right)=\cos\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}\right)+i\sin\left(\frac{5\pi}{2}\right)=i
</math>

and therefore

:<math>
\displaystyle{}(1+i)^{10}=32i.
</math>
statement_html: Evaluate \((1+i)^{10}\) in the form a+ib. Hint write 1+i in polar form.
statement_latex: Evaluate $(1+i)^{10}$ in the form a+ib. Hint write 1+i in polar form.
statement_raw: Evaluate <math>(1+i)^{10}</math> in the form a+ib.  Hint write 1+i in polar form.
